extendedInfo.description: Feem WiFi helps you to PAINLESSLY transfer files in your WiFi or local network. Be it between iPhone, Windows, iPad, Android, Mac or Linux devices. At fast speed. IMPORTANT NOTE: Install Feem WiFi on all devices between which you want to transfer files. Versions for Windows, iPhone, iPad, Mac and Linux are available on http://www.tryfeem.com. If there is no WiFi network around, you can create an ad-hoc network and connect all your Feem devices to it in order to easily exchange files.SUPPORT: Check http://www.tryfeem.com for help or contact info@feeperfect.com directly. Money back guarantee in case it does not work.Feem WiFi comes along with the following features: **** PAINLESS FILE TRANSFER between Windows, Mac, Linux, Android, iPhone and iPad devices. Install Feem WiFi on the respective device and start transferring files painlessly immediately. **** CROSS-PLATFORM: Transfer files between various devices easily. Feem WiFi supports nearly all operating systems on desktop and mobile: Windows, Mac, Linux, Android iPad and iPhone. **** MANY FILES TO MANY PEOPLE: you can send many selected files from each device with Feem WiFi to as many devices with Feem WiFi at once. **** FAST FILE TRANSFER: Feem WiFi uses your full local network speed in order to transfer files. The faster your WiFi or local network, the quicker your files can be transferred. **** SMALL TO HUGE FILES: from little excel documents to huge video files. Install Feem WiFi on the respective device and start transfering files painlessly. **** CHAT: Feem WiFi has a chat function that allows you to chat with other Feem WiFi users in your local network. This facilitates communication and transfering of files. **** AUTO-DISCOVERY: Once Feem WiFi is installed on a device, it will automatically recognize all other devices where Feem WiFi is installed. Very easy and painless. **** AUTO-RESUME: Should a download / upload stop, Feem WiFi has an auto-resume feature which helps resuming interrupted downloads. WHY FEEM WIFI? The answer is almost simplistic in its assertion; yet it holds a lot of truth. We, like most other human beings on this planet, HATE PAIN. It is the reason we cry when we lose a close one. It is the reason we curse when bitten by an insect. It is the reason painkillers even exist in the first place. Yet, sharing files in your local network has become such a PAINFUL exercise over the years. A PAIN shared by more than 500 million wifi-enabled homes. With poor mobile support (USB sticks, Windows Shares), limited cross platform support (Windows Shares), slow transfer speeds (cloud storage, bluetooth), poor usability (bluetooth), and virus infected media (USB sticks), these alternatives are simply a PAIN to use. The need will be greatly felt for a painless alternative, in part because we are now living in a world where most people have more than one computing device with very incompatible systems. How does Feem make local sharing painless. Easy. Here is our secret ingredient. No servers involved. Autodiscovery of peers in a local network. Cross-platform support. And finally, a user friendly interface. Did we mention blazing fast file transfer speeds. This is possible because your file transfers donât go through Mr Slow Sluggish Internet. The moment you launch Feem WiFi, youâll want to start sharing lots of stuff with the people around you. We can almost guarantee that. Make no mistake. Our ambitions are clear. We want Feem to be the de-facto file sharing utility in your homes. Because Feem was designed to be PAINLESS. WHY FEEM WIFI? Because we HATE PAIN.

reviews.title: Rubbish for transferring large files from iOS
reviews.comment: Transferring large files e.g. 200mb from iOS to Android is super slow, and breaks connection after a few kb, so manually have to keep restarting. After 12 hours, still only have 14% of my file. Thats on a fast wifi with 72mb connections reported on both iOS and android.
reviews.author: Adrian Jones

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment: This is so clever. Works, can now transfer file to my HDD network.
reviews.author: Shawn Pigg

reviews.title: Crash every minute!
reviews.comment: It works for the file transfer, but keep on crashing every now and then. Dont seem be able to run in the background.
reviews.author: Sabil Fikri

reviews.title: Not for whole folder sharing!
reviews.comment: This feem does not share \"folder\", i recommending \"Zapya\" for wifi over hotspot sharing, it shares everything from folder, files, whole apps (even the app as big as 250mb sygic!), go try that, you will be in love.
reviews.author: khor hock

reviews.title: Almost as Brilliant as a Sonic Screwdriver!
reviews.comment: Although neither of them work on wood. Not only is this app fast, efficient and user friendly but, the online chat support was phenomenal. They not only helped sort out my LG Optimus7 and my dodgy old laptop but my shiny new iPad too. They also provided extra support by guiding this very un tech savy user, figure out iTunes of all things. Once that was done, the rest was simple. Even for me. I am definitely going to upgrade to the paid site. Thank you so much!
reviews.author: bronwyn Newman

reviews.title: Best file transfer app across diff platforms
reviews.comment: I tried them all, but other WiFi file transfer tools from phone to PC couldn\'t resume disconnected transfers, were slow, painful to establish with many steps etc. This app is better and can do it all. You can also let it run in the background and keep using your phone. Keep up the good work and thanks for this long awaited, simple tool that just works.
reviews.author: Mz S

reviews.comment: Works but no way to exit the app. What\'s up with that?

reviews.comment: This app is so useful and convenient, it\'s awesome! I like it!

reviews.title: Cross-platform file transfers made easy
reviews.comment: With a hoard of paid wifi-sync and file transfer apps seemingly taking over the Play Store, it is refreshing to see one that is totally free, and works just as well. I could easily seeing paying for the functionality that this app offers. My thanks to the developers for keeping this app free, in the true sense of the word.
